overview.title: Components Overview
overview.description: Idealyst provides a comprehensive library of cross-platform components. All components work identically on web and native with platform-specific optimizations.

intentColors.title: Intent Colors
intentColors.description: Components support intent-based colors: primary, neutral, success, error, warning

variants.title: Variants
variants.description: Many components offer visual variants like contained, outlined, text (buttons) or filled, outlined, soft (chips)

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Most components support size variants: xs, sm, md, lg, xl

button.title: Button
button.description: Interactive button component with multiple variants, sizes, and icon support. Supports intent colors for semantic meaning and works identically on web and native.

card.title: Card
card.description: Container component for grouping related content. Cards support different visual variants including elevated, outlined, and filled styles.

accordion.title: Accordion
accordion.description: Expandable content section that can show or hide content when clicked. Useful for FAQs, collapsible menus, and progressive disclosure.

alert.title: Alert
alert.description: Contextual feedback messages for user actions. Supports different intents for success, error, warning, and informational messages.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.description: Circular image component for displaying user profile pictures, icons, or initials. Supports different sizes and fallback content.

badge.title: Badge
badge.description: Small count or status indicator that can be attached to other elements. Commonly used for notification counts or status indicators.

breadcrumb.title: Breadcrumb
breadcrumb.description: Navigation component that shows the current page location within a hierarchy. Helps users understand where they are and navigate back.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.description: Form control for boolean selections. Supports checked, unchecked, and indeterminate states with customizable styling.

chip.title: Chip
chip.description: Compact element representing an input, attribute, or action. Useful for tags, filters, and selections.

dialog.title: Dialog
dialog.description: Modal overlay that requires user interaction. Used for confirmations, forms, and important notifications that need attention.

divider.title: Divider
divider.description: Visual separator that can be used to divide content sections. Supports horizontal and vertical orientations.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Scalable vector icon component with support for Material Design icons. Customizable size and color.

input.title: Input
input.description: Text input field for forms. Supports different types, validation states, labels, and helper text.

link.title: Link
link.description: Navigation component for creating hyperlinks. Integrates with the navigation system for internal routing.

list.title: List
list.description: Continuous vertical display of items. Supports single and multi-selection, icons, and custom content.

menu.title: Menu
menu.description: Dropdown menu component for displaying a list of actions or options. Supports keyboard navigation and nested menus.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: Visual indicator of progress or loading state. Supports linear and circular variants with determinate and indeterminate modes.

radioButton.title: Radio Button
radioButton.description: Form control for selecting one option from a group. Only one radio button in a group can be selected at a time.

select.title: Select
select.description: Dropdown selection component for choosing from a list of options. Supports single and multi-select modes.

skeleton.title: Skeleton
skeleton.description: Placeholder loading component that mimics content shape while data is loading. Improves perceived performance.

slider.title: Slider
slider.description: Range input component for selecting values within a range. Supports single and range selection with step increments.

switch.title: Switch
switch.description: Toggle control for binary on/off settings. Provides immediate visual feedback of the current state.

table.title: Table
table.description: Tabular data display component with sorting, pagination, and selection support. Optimized for large datasets.

text.title: Text
text.description: Typography component for rendering text content. Supports different styles, weights, and semantic HTML elements.

textArea.title: Text Area
textArea.description: Multi-line text input for longer form content. Supports auto-resizing, character limits, and validation.

tooltip.title: Tooltip
tooltip.description: Popup that displays information related to an element when hovered or focused. Supports different placements.
